tuv.seg: This document introduces the Government of Ireland
Tá eolas ar fáil anseo faoin Rialtas
Government and Dáil Éireann
An Rialtas agus Dáil Éireann
The Government and Dáil Éireann (the lower house of the Irish parliament) have a close relationship
Tá caidreamh dlúth idir an Rialtas agus Dáil Éireann (teach íochtair na parlaiminte Éireannaigh)
Description and explanation of this relationship
Cur síos agus míniú faoin gcaidreamh seo
The Taoiseach is the head of Government
Tá an Taoiseach i gceannas ar an Rialtas
Role and responsibilities of the Taoiseach are discussed
Déantar cuir síos anseo ar ról agus freagrachtaí an Taoisigh
The Tanaiste is the deputy Taoiseach.He or she acts in place of the Taoiseach if the Taoiseach is abroad or ill
Déantar cuir síos anseo ar ról an Táiniste sa Rialtas
The Attorney General is the legal adviser to the Irish Government
Déantar cuir síos anseo ar an Ard Aighne agus ar an ról atá acu
The Government Chief Whip is responsible for organising and co-ordinating Government business in Dáil Éireann (the lower house of the Irish parliament)
Tá Príomhaoire an Rialtais freagrach as eagrú agus comhordú a dhéanamh ar ghnóthaí an Rialtais i nDáil Éireann (teach íochtair na parlaiminte Éireannaigh)
This document describes the circumstances in which a coalition government can be set up and how it functions
Déantar cuir síos anseo ar na fáthanna a gcuirtear comhrialtas le chéile agus conas mar a oibríonn sé
The Irish constitution sets out the membership of the Government
Leagann Bunreacht na hÉireann síos ballraíocht na Rialtais
Explanation of these members and links to current Ministers
Míniú na baill seo agus naisc le hAirí reatha
Most Read in "Government in Ireland"
Ábhar is mó éilimh i "Rialtas in Éirinn"
Fundamental Rights under the Irish Constitution
Bunchearta faoi Bhunreacht na hÉireann
